description.narrative: Output for 2016-2017: D'ici fin 2017, les services techniques disposent de capacitÃ©s renforcÃ©es pour la crÃ©ation d'un environnement favorable pour le secteur de l'eau potable, de l'hygiÃ¨ne et de l'assainissement.Output for 2014-2015: By the end of 2015, at least 50% of schools and nutrition centres of the of the Plateau Central, Centre Nord, Est, Boucle du Mouhoun and Hauts Bassins regions have the minimum Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) package (drinking water points, latrines, hand washing, awareness of basic hygiene) and apply the basic rules of hygieneOutput 2011-2013: By the end of 2013, 30 % of population and 60 % of students (girls and boys) of the Plateau Central and Center North regions have the competencies to adopt proper individual and collective hygiene measures on sanitation and drinking water., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: D'ici fin 2017, l'UNICEF contribue Ã accroitre l'accÃ¨s Ã l'eau potable et Ã l'assainissement amÃ©liorÃ©e au milieu rural. By 2015, the percentage of the population using a safe water source for drinking water increases from 56 per cent to 76 per cent, and the percentage of households using improved sanitation facilities increases from 10 per cent to 54 per cent.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued its efforts carrying out the Action Research on an innovative management model for rural water service delivery through Public Private Partnerships, the strengthening of knowledge management and sector-wide learning, as well as supporting the ministry directorates to implement their action plans for the national post-2015 programs. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:30/03/2018
